title: German gloom as latest figures suggest country is already in recession
text:
German finance minister Olaf Scholz said last week that Germany would be able to cope with an economic crisis

German industry has suffered another blow in a further sign the country is already in recession.

On a bleak day for the eurozone, government figures showed orders for goods stamped ‘Made in Germany’ fell 0.6 per cent in August.

The slump fuelled fears that the German economy shrank in the third quarter of the year following a decline of 0.1 per cent in the second quarter. A second quarter of decline would leave the country in recession.

‘The German economy is in the midst of a recession. Today’s data make that clear again,’ said Thomas Gitzel, economist at VP Bank Group.

Finance Minister Olaf Scholz said last week that Germany would be able to cope with an economic crisis but added he did not expect a downturn to be as bad as it was in 2008/09.

Germany’s export-reliant manufacturers are suffering from a slowing world economy and business uncertainty linked to a trade dispute between the United States and China, as well as Britain’s planned, but delayed, exit from the EU.
